member.name: T:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.LoginPage
member.summary: Third-party provider authentication control for the Windows Phone platform.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.LoginPage.#ctor
member.summary: Initiatlizes the page by hooking up some event handlers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.LoginPage.BrowserControl_LoadCompleted(System.Object,System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the browser control's load completed event. We use this to detect when to hide the progress bar and show the browser control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.LoginPage.OnNavigatedTo(System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationEventArgs)
member.summary: Initiates the authentication operation by pointing the browser control to the PhoneWebAuthenticationBroker.StartUri. If the PhoneWebAuthenticationBroker isn't currently in the middle of an authentication operation, then we immediately navigate back.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.LoginPage.OnNavigatingFrom(System.Windows.Navigation.NavigatingCancelEventArgs)
member.summary: Updates the PhoneWebAuthenticationBroker on the state of the authentication operation. If we navigated back by pressing the back key, then the operation will be canceled. If the browser control successfully completed the operation, signaled by its navigating to the PhoneWebAuthenticationBroker.EndUri, then we pass the results on.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.LoginPage.LoginPage_BackKeyPress(System.Object,System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the page's back key events. We use this to determine whether navigations away from this page are benign (such as going to the start screen) or actually meant to cancel the operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.LoginPage.BrowserControl_Navigating(System.Object,Microsoft.Phone.Controls.NavigatingEventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the browser control's navigating event. We use this to detect when login has completed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.LoginPage.BrowserControl_NavigationFailed(System.Object,System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationFailedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handler for the browser control's navigation failed event. We use this to detect errors

member.summary: Shows the progress bar and hides the browser control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.LoginPage.HideProgressBar
member.summary: Hides the progress bar and shows the browser control.

member.summary: An AuthenticationBroker for the Windows Phone Platform that is like the Windows Store WebAuthenticationBroker APIs.

member.summary: Instantiates a new .

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.AuthenticationBroker.AuthenticateAsync(System.Uri,System.Uri,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Begins a server-side authentication flow by navigating the WebAuthenticationBroker to the .
member.param: The URL that the browser-based control should first navigate to in order to start the authenication flow.

The URL that indicates the authentication flow has completed. Upon being redirected to any URL that starts with the , the browser-based control must stop navigating and return the response data to the .
Indicates if single sign-on should be used so that users do not have to re-enter his/her credentials every time.
member.returns: The response data from the authentication flow that contains a string of JSON that represents a Mobile Services authentication token.
member.exception: Thrown if the user cancels the authentication flow or an error occurs during the authentication flow.

member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.AuthenticationBroker.GetTokenStringFromResponseData(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the JSON string that represents the Mobile Service authentication token from the result of the authentication attempt.
member.param: The response data returned from the WebAuthenticationBroker.
member.returns: A JSON string that represents a Mobile Service authentication token.
member.exception: Thrown if the authentication flow resulted in an error message or an invalid response.

member.param: The string to search for the .
The string to look for in the
